title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 3.6 - Special procedures for commercial driver licenses (CDL)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 3.6 - Special procedures for commercial driver licenses (CDL)

State Regulations
(a) An application for a commercial driver's
license will not be accepted if the applicant is not a resident of this State. In addition, an application shall not be accepted unless the applicant presents
acceptable proofs of United States citizenship or lawful permanent residency, as prescribed by the commissioner. For the purposes of this Part, the term
resident
shall mean domiciliary as defined in subdivision 5 of
section
250
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law. (b) No
CDL will be issued on the basis of reciprocity as provided in Part 8 of this

Part unless the applicant is the holder of a valid commercial driver's license
issued by the applicant's former jurisdiction of residence. (c) No CDL will be issued to any person whose
record disqualifies him or her from holding a CDL. (d) No CDL will be issued without passage of
the CDL general knowledge test. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
3.6

York State Register, Volume XXXVI, Issue 28, effective
7/16/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
